children.name: SLA
children.desc: The SLA describes the IT service, documents service level targets, and specifies the responsibilities of the IT service provider and the customer.

children.name: SLR
children.desc: The Service Level Requirements document contains the requirements for a service from the client viewpoint, defining detailed service level targets, mutual responsibilities, and other requirements specific to a certain (group of) customers.

children.name: GovTech
children.tip: GovTech aims to build better services for citizens and better tools for public servants.

children.desc:
• Supports the Commission Decision 2017/46
  • Complements the effort of the EC for the protection of the information systems
  • Proposes practical choices of implementation of these processes:

    • Actionable tasks and methods
    • Scales
    • Catalogues

children.name: Pricing
children.tip: Exercice allowing unit price calculation + extra layer before publication

children.name: Showback
children.tip: Client consumption shown but not billed. Clients reports are visible on 'Unified reporting'.

children.name: TSE
children.desc: Technical Service Element is an internal (technical) element in a certain sector, to which we map the activity codes and the hosting of the IS (if any).

children.name: BSE
children.desc: Business Service Element is the service itself, the one we sell to our customers. A BSE can have one TSE mapped to it 100% or can be combined by several TSEs from different Units/Directorates.

children.name: Cost Driver
children.desc: Cost Driver is the measurable element which defines the unit cost of each element:<dl><dt>TSE's cost driver</dt><dd>virtual driver (100%)</dd><dt>BSE's cost driver</dt><dd>the value of the driver on the 1st of January Y(n).</dd></dl>The cost driver of a BSE is the value of the driver fixed on January 1st of the considered year.

children.name: Costing
children.tip: The exercise of calculating the real unit cost at the end of the annual pricing exercise

children.name: Pricing
children.tip: The extra layer added by the Director before publishing

children.name: CAM
children.desc: Central piece to ensure a correct management of our private keys and our integrity. Initially foreseen for the ECI (European Citizen Initiative), other clients (CLIMA) have expressed their interest. The CAM service will become essential for a future consumption from the public cloud to ensure that our cypto’s assets are under our control.

children.name: CRUD/View
children.tip: Direct SID access (Create Read Update Delete)

children.name: SIP
children.desc: A SIP address is a URI that addresses a specific telephone extension on a voice over IP system. Such a number could be a private branch exchange or an E. 164 telephone number dialled through a specific gateway. The scheme was defined in RFC 3261. SIP is used for signaling and controlling multimedia communication sessions in applications of Internet telephony for voice and video calls, in private IP telephone systems, in instant messaging over Internet Protocol (IP) networks as well as mobile phone calling over LTE (VoLTE).

children.name: GAMA
children.desc: 'GAMA' is a consultative committee, which performs a final check on procedures from DG HR, OIB, OIL, DIGIT, PMO and EPSO and is composed of designated members thereof. The consultation takes place after the evaluation and before the award of the contract and is obligatory for any procurement procedure reaching or exceeding the directive threshold as estimated total value. Authorising officers can either specifically request for their procedure to be examined by GAMA, or a sampling method will select (according to specific characteristics/risk factors) two out of all submitted procedures for examination by GAMA in their monthly meeting. The examinations then result in a positive or negative opinion and (if applicable) recommendations for the AOSD. Unit HR.DDG.R1 holds the presidency and secretariat of GAMA.

children.name: Workflow (Lnx wls)
children.desc: ABAC Workflow is the module used for daily financial/budgetary management by the majority of users. Each user has specific responsibilities in line with the Financial Regulation and its Rules of Application. This is reflected as the user signs documents -according to his/her role- (e.g. Initiating Agent, Verifying Agent, Authorising Officer by Subdelegation) passing through an omni-present “workflow”.
